Portal. (Or Portal 1 as it is known as) is an excellent product that explains to you why isolation is... not great for humans. Isolation was accepting death in our primitive state. You had to socialise to stay alive. And Portal, well doesn't really feature socialization. Until you reach the companion cube. This cube with hearts on all sides accompanies you throughout Test Chamber 17. You have to rely on it to complete the test, and it has to rely on you to move it around. Nothing really stands out, until Test Chamber 16. At the end, the monotone voice: GLaDOS. Uses scare tactics on turrets, that can talk, and feel pain. So the turrets are sentient? Right? Well, of course. But GLaDos also hints to the companion cube to being sentient. Saying such things like, it will  never threaten to stab and you, and cannot speak. However she actually tries to hide that fact, but reveals it in Portal 2.

In Portal 2, everything is sentient. Panels, Walls, and anything else.
Even Wheatley hints to turrets being sentient, and the choir at the end confirms that. Aswell as the All Knowing Turret.

In Portal, you fight GLaDos and kill her. She has Four Cores attached to her: Morality, Curiosity, Intelligence and Anger.
I saw a comment on LeadHead's "Portal, Cracks in the System." Where it makes a point by saying she tried to use reverse psychology on you by dropping the morality core. She wants you to not touch it, but you're her enemy at this point. So of course you would.

Without Morality, She can use rocket defenses, neurotoxin and whatever.
Without Curiosity, She has no incentive to keep you alive anymore.
Without Intelligence, She resorts to bitter anger.
Without Anger, She f*cking dies. ;)

She also says this:
Things have changed since you last left the building.
What's going on out there, will make you wish you were back in here.
And:
I have an infinite capacity for knowledge, and even i'm not sure what's going on out there.

She references the Combine from Half-Life 2, or the Black Mesa Incident.

This game? 10/10.

评分：10/10

+
1，十分出彩的游戏设计和玩法
2，地图关卡设计很有脑洞
3，高级地图和挑战模式作为对游戏的补充，设计出色，很需要对游戏很深的理解以及自身的操作，能通过会有很强的成就感
4，剧情很棒，彩蛋也很到位
5，还有很多优点

- 
1，游戏通关时间短，多来点多来点

Excelente!

Not only is Portal one of my favorites, I'd say that it's one of the best games of all time. With a sleek design, and streamlined gameplay, the only fault that I feel Portal has is how gosh darn short the game is. That's all the more reason to get the second one as well.

In terms of looks this game still holds up to modern games. In the way it runs, this game is quick, even on older computers. This game is the full package to this day, and probably the best puzzle game of all time. Still waiting for Portal 3, Valve.

Game was engaging and intriguing. The mechanics were simple yet creative, making each puzzle seem like something new while keeping it making sense. You have to really think through the puzzles and I enjoyed that. The story was a bit vague near the end but that was intentional so no fault there. 10/10 will play again.

Big Half Life universe fan. I haven't played this game in years. Such fun! Great puzzle solving using portal gun, lab blocks and door buttons, and other creative methods like portal catapulting. GLaDOS is one of the best antagonists in any game! She's sarcastic and funny, telling lies and taunting you the whole way. Just an awesome game.

"Still Alive" is a hilarious song, maybe the single greatest part of the game.

Среди всех поднаскучивших шутеров и прочих игр в 2007 Валв выпускают эту игру. И это просто глоток свежего воздуха. Расслабляющая и при этом заставляющая извилины поднапрячься игра на протяжении всего сюжета томит вас на медленном огне под соусом "а что будет дальше?". И после пройденных тестов начинается совершенно иной интерес к игре. 
Маленький шедевр, вышедший в составе сборника The Orange Box, и который, тем не менее, не затерялся в тени монструозной Half-Life. Эксперимент очевидно уд...удачный!!!
